Leland follows the story of Leland P. Fitzgerald (Ryan Gosling), a disaffected teenager who has apparently murdered a severely retarded peer, the brother of his would-be lover and mentally unstable classmate Erica (Rachel McAdams). This is pretty much your run-of-the-mill high school tragedy film until Eric finds out who did it and kills Leland in revenge. At which point it actually becomes interesting.

Latter Days is a very, VERY independent movie. And compared to many of today's more modern films, it's lacking on many parts. The shooting can be very unsteady at times and in comparison to what audiences normally see these days, it may feel as if the budget barely reached its goal. However, with all the negative points aside one needs to appreciate what filmmaker Robert Ickes was attempting to do here though.
